Sentencas: Ceria doped with aliovalent cations, such as rare earth oxides, has been considered as one of the most promising candidate electrolyte materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Study on Sm3+ and Er3+ Co-Doped CeO2-Based Electrolytes

Sentencas: In this study, high purity cerium nitrate, samarium nitrate and erbium nitrate salts were used to obtain ceria-based solid solutions Ce0.80Sm0.20O1.90 (SDC), Ce0.80Sm0.15Er0.05O1.90 (ESDC5), Ce0.80Sm0.10Er0.10O1.90 (ESDC10) through the cellulose templating method.
Titulo: Study on Sm3+ and Er3+ Co-Doped CeO2-Based Electrolytes

Sentencas: Crystal structure and microstructure were characterized by means of X-ray diffraction and scanning electron microscopy, respectively.
Titulo: Study on Sm3+ and Er3+ Co-Doped CeO2-Based Electrolytes

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction results indicate that a single-phase fluorite structure formed at a relatively low calcination temperature, 500 degrees C.
Titulo: Study on Sm3+ and Er3+ Co-Doped CeO2-Based Electrolytes

Sentencas: The relative densities of the sintered pellets were higher than 93%.
Titulo: Study on Sm3+ and Er3+ Co-Doped CeO2-Based Electrolytes

Sentencas: The electrical properties of doped and co-doped ceria electrolytes in the temperature range 300-750 degrees C were analyzed by using electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Study on Sm3+ and Er3+ Co-Doped CeO2-Based Electrolytes

Sentencas: The singly doped ceria at 750 degrees C showed the highest ionic conductivity with less activation energy.
Titulo: Study on Sm3+ and Er3+ Co-Doped CeO2-Based Electrolytes
